1.content:
"Honey, I'm home." You say intentionally trying to make your fiance cringe. Walking into the new house you two bought together, the novelty of owning your first house and living a couple of states away from your families has not worn out on you yet. You and April, after saving up enough money, were finally able to afford moving to this house in Salem Oregon. Inheriting it from a deceased relative also helped bring the price down, people tend to not want to live where someone died. Don't worry, they died of old age and natural causes.

"You're home early." You hear the lovely voice of your better half say from up the stairs. Looking around the house, the hard wood floors, the light blue walls with white trimmings, the clean white tile floor of the kitchen in the room over, the 36 inch flat screen TV in the living room,you just take it all in. Happy to be done with work.

"It was only a half day. Where you at April?" You ask while ascending the stairs.

"I'm in the attic. It took us just under two months, but I finally finished unpacking all of our stuff."

"Did you ever think after all of these years we'd move into a house that looks like the one from Hocus Pocus."

"I love our Hocus Pocus house." You walk into the attic to see your soon to be wife putting away some boxes into the corner. She is wearing tight jeans, with a white thermal hoodie that has a big black horizontal strip in the middle. Her black hair freshly combed and smelling like shampoo as you sneak up behind her to place a kiss on her neck.

"How was school today?"

"Don't know, didn't have school today. And I won't have school for the rest of the summer." She turns around to return the kiss. That's one of the plus sides to being an elementary school teacher, summer vacation.

"Well, you can school me any time you want, Mrs. McCallister." You two exchange kisses until April suddenly remembers something she wanted to show you.

"Wait Marty, check this out. I found something cool I wanted to show you." Your future wife pulls out an old dusty box. "I think this was left over from the previous owners."

"Right, your great aunt, or was it your uncle?"

"I thought it was one of your relatives?" You both ponder over who's relative it was, the explanation having a lot of different aunts, uncles, spouses, and cousins involved. "Anyways, check this out. I think it's an antique music box." She pulls out a hand crafted wooden box. The sides have panels like a Rubik's cube with circles in the center of each face.

"Think its worth anything?"

"I'm not sure." April opens the top of the box. Inside there is a mirror, the lid has an inscription carved into it. April puts on her reading glasses. "It says, A gift to those who wish to seek out new fantasy's made real. What is impossible shall become reality to fulfill the physical needs of the mortal heart."

"Maybe we should put back the creepy dead person's box that has old timey English carved into it."

"What's wrong, this thing seems cool."

"There are tons of horror movies that start out like this. In fact, I don't think I've ever seen a movie where finding an old, creepy, dusty thing ever leads to something good."

"What about Jumanji."

"Robin Williams ended up in the jungle for 20 years." April ignores your points as she twists and turns around the bottom of the box. The mirror inside rotates and changes like a kaleidoscope, she twists around the circle panel in the center one of the panels until it pops forward like a button. She presses it then there was a loud bang and flash of light. "What was that?" You ask as you get up, something knocked you to the ground, you think.

"I'm not sure, can you help me up." You walk over to April, she must have fallen onto the stack of boxes, this room needs cleaning up now. You pick her up, noticing that her hair is now in a bun and her reading glasses look thicker. "Are you okay?"

"Well, I don't seem to be suffering from any major injuries. I am not sure where that light illuminated from, nor what force caused me to fall but I am perfectly healthy." April says to you as if she is talking to one of her students.

"I don't know what that was either but it was one hell of a surprise. Ha ha." You hear April's voice but it was coming from behind you. You turn around and see April picking herself from out of the pile of boxes except now she has her hair in pigtails.

"What the fuck." You say out of shock as you see the cheerful looking brunette.

"Who's she." The April in front of you says. "Who's she?" The April behind you says. "Who are they." The April to the left of you says.

"What the fuck." The third girl looks a lot more pale than the other two as she steps out from the shadows. Her pigtails are braided, her hair being pitch black and she is wearing black lipstick with black mascara.

"Well, this is something that doesn't happen every day." The goth April says in a dead pan tone.

"Oh wow, this is cool. I mean weird but cool." The cheery April comments as she takes a step closer to analyze her doppelgangers. "It's like I'm seeing double, wait make that triple." She points out another April with her hair tied back in a ponytail. Her arms crossed as she taps her foot with an annoyed expression.

"What the fuck."

"We heard you the first time for fucks sake. Now can someone explain to me why I'm standing here with me myself and I in the same room." The angry April says.

"Okay wait." You try to bring some order into this. "Is there anyone else here? Is this everyone?"

"I'm here." A quiet quivering voice comes in behind you as a fifth April walks in. Her long hair partially draped over her face as if she is trying to hide.

"Okay, so there is five of you."

"Five Aprils, that's gotta be super confusing." The cheery one points out.

"Maybe we should come up with nicknames. Just to simple things down." The newest April says as she strokes her hair in a nervous manner. The five girls start arguing over who's gonna be called April, the assertive one trying to claim it but gets shot down by the others. You knew the only fair way was for you to decide on what to call them.

"Hey, I'll decide since I'm impartial to all of this." You then start pointing to each one. "Autumn, Winter, Summer, Spring... and June." You point to the Goth, Brainy, Grumpy, Happy, and Shy Aprils in that order.

"Really, you're too lazy to pick actual names, you just chose seasons and a month?" The aggressive April, you mean Summer said. "I mean were you looking at a calendar or something. At this point we should be happy you didn't choose colors."

"Fine, those monikers will have to do but we should figure out how to get us back to one. There shouldn't be five of us.That is not even possible." The Winter remarks.

"Yeah, no shit Sherlock. You wanna try figuring this out Poindexter." Summer snaps back.

"Well, conventional means did not do this to us. It's not possible to split a person up into five with science. Which only leaves magic and I think that is a factor no one can argue with the evidence we have observed." The one with the glasses is right. You noticed that they are all your fiance but they are all different. There is a goth one, a brainy one, a shy one, a tempered one, and a happy one. The happy April takes the magic box and proceeds to mess around with it. "What are you doing?"

"What, you said this thing is what split us. Maybe it can un-split us." The two begin to fight over it as the others get involved rearranging the box until a bright light flashes. In trying to reverse this spell, a new one was cast on the girls instead. What happens to them?

To reiterate:
Grumpy April = Summer
Happy April = Spring
Goth April = Autumn
Shy April = June
Brainy April = Winter

11.content:
A bright flash of light bursts out of the box and before you knew it, you were knocked back and lying on the ground. Déjà vu, you open your eyes and try to look around but everything was a blur. "Hey, is everyone alright. April are you all together now or... not?"

"I think I'm all together." You hear her.

"I don't think you are." You hear her voice again only in a dry tone.

"What makes you say that." An April asks in a bubbly air head voice.

"You wouldn't be talking to yourself if you were." Your vision clears up as the different Aprils continue this discussion.

"Does anyone know if this thing did anything?" The agitated one asks out of frustration. They all turn towards the nerdy April with the glasses and hair bun as she picks up the box to investigate.

"It appears not, or at least there were no further side effects caused by the release of light on it's second opening." She puts the box back inside of the cardboard box they originally found it in. "We should probably refrain from touching it until we gather more information on this trinket. I'll try seeing what I can find on the internet and... what is it that everyone is observing at?" You stand stunned as the brainy April turns around, her nose now looking less human and more elephant...?

"Um, April. It's your nose. It... well maybe you should look." You say as you bring out your phone's camera to show her.

"Curious. It appears there was a delayed side effect after all. I, I have a trunk." As she inspects her face more her trunk grows longer, going down towards her chest as her skin turns gray. Everyone is too shocked to say anything, you aren't sure if the girl this is happening too is staying silent due to her being stunned or lost in a train of thought as she analyzes this transformation. Her ears start growing larger, followed by two teeth that grow into small tusks. "Curious and more curious, I think the transformation has ceased, I appear to be part human and part pachyderm."

"I thought you were part elephant." The cheery April says which causes the elephant girl to face palm with her own trunk.

"This is bad." The shy April says as she stays close to her doubles. "What if we all turn into animals."

"Then we all turn into animals." The girl in pigtails says optimistically. "Honestly, that looks kind of cool. At least you still have hands and not, whatever it is elephants have."

"Well, better her than me." The brunette with a ponytail says with a grin. "I don't know how I'd stand looking in a mirror if I had that thing dangling on my face. Ha."

"Well, at least I don't have fur."

"What do you mean by that. Wait, let me see that phone." The grumpy April swipes the phone and sees that the elephant April wasn't lying. She had white fur growing throughout her body with black patches including one on her right eye. "What, what the hell am I." Her mussel area extends outward and turns pink while a pair of horns grow out of her hair. Her ears stretch out to look more like cattle ears and her breasts swell up a couple of bra sizes until they reach an E-cup. This April isn't the only one who is horny as you get a little chubby from seeing that.

"At first I was gonna say you were a jackass, but more appropriately you are a cow." The brainy April retorts.

"Who are you calling a cow, trunk face." She looks down and cups her impressive new bust with a smile. "At least I filled out nicely." You just sit back and watch this cat fight unfold with the other Aprils. Is it still considered a cat fight? You look over and notice that the goth looking April now looks sick.

"Hey are you alright, you look green." You ask her as the two continue to argue.

"I feel fine. Can you not touch me please." She asks the shy April huddled next to her.

"I'm not touching you."

"I can feel your tail." You all take a double take as, yes indeed the awkward April has a long pink rope like tail poking out from her back.

"Oh no, no, no." She whispers to herself as gray fur grows around her. Her nose protruding from her face while whisker grow out, her two front teeth growing with a little gap between them. Her ears becoming large and round and moving higher up on her head until they are sticking out from her brunette hair. Her height also shrinks down a couple of inches as she is now noticeably shorter than her other doppelgangers. "What am I, is it okay? Please be honest."

"Aw, don't worry. You're just a mouse." The cheery one tries to console her. "A cute mouse. And adorable mouse. Right guys."

"Yeah, cute." You add in which helps her from sobbing and smiles a little. You look over to the green Alice and now see that her eyes have grown larger and are a bright red. Her nose has disappeared into two small nasal slits, her ears are gone, her mouth is wider and she now has yellow skin under her lip and down her chest. Speaking of skin, it now looks slimy and scaly, she looks like a ninja turtle.

"What? What did I turn into?" She asks as she notices you staring.

"I think you are a red eyed tree frog." She looks at her hands, the palms yellow while the back is green with her finger tips being puffy. She looks down and kicks off her shoes, her toes are now webbed and longer than before.

"Eh, I was expecting something cooler." She brushes it off, not being too fazed after seeing everyone else change.

"Ooh, is it my turn." The happy April says excitedly. "I bet it's my turn. I wonder if I'll be a bird, or maybe something like a dog or a tiger." As she rambles on about different animals you all notice whisker started growing from her face, also her pigtails are no longer pigtails but large, white rabbit ears. Her front teeth grows out just like mouse April, with her nose turning small and pink. She keeps talking until she notices white fur growing on her and looks at a mirror to see what she has become. "Oh My Gosh. I'm a bunny! I'm a cute little rabbit girl. Look I have these ears, and a cute little cotton tail." She turns around to shake the little puff ball that has popped our from her jeans. "Oh I'm like the cutest playboy bunny ever. Oh wait." She bends over to take off her shoes. Large rabbit feet fold out of them as she removes them from the tight confines of her sneakers. Wiggling her toes as they stretch out from her 18 inch long feet. "Aw, that's better."

"Know that that ordeal is over with, I suggest we all collaborate on a plan." The brainy April says as everyone adjust to their new fursonas.

To reiterate:
Grumpy April = Cow
Happy April = Rabbit
Goth April = Frog
Shy April = Mouse
Brainy April = Elephant

12.content:
As the girls rearranged the box, a burst of light flashed. Before you knew it, you were lying on the ground. Whatever happened also knocked out the light, the attic was pitch black except for the light entering from the entrance. "April, you there. Is everything, you know. Back to normal?" You turn on the flashlight on your phone and walk deeper into the attic, the room being a lot bigger than you thought. You almost trip as your foot hits something, looking down you see it's your fiance. "Oh sorry April. You okay." You reach down to pick her up.

"Yeah, I'm good." She stands and brushes off the dust on her, her hair is in pigtails and she smiles back at you with her lips going ear to ear.

"Is there just you or more of you?"

"I think there is more. I don't know. I don't feel all there, do I look all there?"

"Uh, how do you feel?"

"Happy. Well, more than happy, like super stoked. Maybe it has something to do with me and you all alone in the dark." You are unprepared for this April's abrasive advances as she throws herself into your arms and you two begin to make out. Getting frisky in a creepy attic, if this was a horror movie this would be the time when a big scary monster would pop out.

"Get away from him you bitch." You almost shit yourself as you hear the roar of an angry girlfriend right behind you. Turning around you flash your light and see a pissed off April looking way scarier than ever. She stands taller than you now, looking like she has went through an accident as she has stitches across her neck, forehead, and wrists. Her skin looks a shade greener, she has a white streak on her left and right side of her ponytail hair and what's more alarming are the electrical bolts sticking out of her neck. This Frankensteined up April grabs her smaller double as they tussle for your affection.

"Hey, stop it. Stop, this is crazy. You're both the same person." You try to reason with them but no luck.

"How dare you kiss my man you floozy."

"Your man, he's mine too. I didn't see you call dibs." The two continued to fight and the smaller April gets tossed to the ground, her pigtails come undone. "HHOOOWWWLLLL." She bellows as fangs start growing, her nails lengthen into claws and fur grows on her. Her hair turns brown to match her fur, which grows around her face like the old Wolfman movies. "Claws are out now." She jumps at the other April. It's like watching Frankenstein Meets The Wolfman if your fiance was playing both parts.

"Would you two stop this fighting." You hear yet another April, this one wearing a black cloak. "I doubt ripping each other apart is gonna help anyone out." She takes off her hood and judging from the braided hair, this was the goth April, looking more goth now that her face is pale white.

"And why should I listen to you little black riding hood?" The stitched up girl asks.

"Hissss." April reveals her big fangs, as if these two weren't bad enough, now there is a vampire to add to the mix. It's like Halloween in June, if the people wearing the costumes really were their costumes. "Now if we're done we should, wait. Why is there three of us."

"Yeah, where are the other two?" You ask as you search more of the attic with your phone's flashlight. You then see a set of the clothes the other April's were wearing, the thermal hoodie and jeans but they were standing on their own as if someone was wearing them. The arm sleeve then starts waving to you.

"Hi." The shy version of your girl says bashfully.

"Are you invisible? Because that is so cool, that's like a superpower." Werewolf April asks, her tail starts wagging and inadvertently hitting you.

"Oh, I am. I didn't know, let me try something." Shy April starts to materialize in her clothes but she is transparent and her skin and hair are white.

"I think you're a ghost." You say, more like thinking out loud.

"Oh no, did I die?"

"Maybe we should ask the smart one about that." Vampire April says.

"I think I saw something over here." You all follow the ghost girl as she leads you to a gold casket leaning against the wall. Where the hell did this thing come from? They all look at you, expecting you to open it up, so you do. You open the casket and a hand reaches out to grab you.

"AAAAHHHHHH!" You all scream from being startled. The hand was covered in bandages, it was attached to an April covered in them from head to toe underneath her clothes. In between the bandages you can see that her skin was gray. This April still had her glasses on, and her hair sticking out in a bun but was once dark brown is now colored white. Now you know how Shaggy felt in that Ghoul School movie. Your heart races faster as you stand in this dark attic with what looks like a Monster High convention.

To reiterate:
Grumpy April = Frankenstein's Monster
Happy April = Werewolf
Goth April = Vampire
Shy April = Ghost
Brainy April = Mummy

123.content:
"MMMmmm. HHRrmmm. Erm!" The bandaged up mummy tries to talk but all you hear is mumbles through her thick bandages.

"Oh great. She's mute." Summer says crossing her arms. Winter looks up at her and rearranges the bandages around her mouth to move them out of the way.

"I'm not mute you simpleton. My mouth was just suppressed by these bandage wrappings." She tries to remove more but they are skin tight.

"Maybe that isn't a good idea." The shy ghost girl tries to interject. You can all see that behind the wraps, Winter's skin looks dried out. The pale gray skin looks like it is in major need of a moisturizer as dust particles spring up whenever she tries to remove more of the bandages.

"I suppose you are right. In my physical condition it is difficult to tell if these wrappings are keeping me together or not. Scientifically they shouldn't be but ancient Egyptian magic would most likely not follow the laws of reality." Everyone looks around at each other silently agreeing with her. After all, science cannot explain how a music box managed to split your fiance into five different versions of her. Nor can it explain why they all look like they came off the set of a Paramount movie lot.

"Can we get out of the attic?" You suggest. "It's just that, it's dark, and creepy, and I feel like we have spent more time in an attic than a person should spend in an attic." All of the other Aprils agreed with either a nod or a verbal 'yeah'. "Okay, lets regroup downstairs." As soon as you finished that sentence, you felt a furry creature grab your arm and hold on tight to it.

"God, stop smothering him you little attention whore." The tall, green skinned Summer says to Spring with a look of disgust on her face.

"Why don't you mind you own business. Grrrr." The affectionate werewolf literally growls back being very protective of you.

"Stop it you two. Don't make me spray water at you." Autumn snide comment comes from halfway down the stairs as she heads up the group. "Aaah." Autumn screams as she steps into sunlight beaming in through the window. Steam pours out of her skin before she steps back into the shade, Summer rushes up ahead and closes the blinds. "Ouch, that really burned."

"Hey, at least you weren't sparkling." Summer jokes. You all soon follow the tall, green, stitched up girl down to the second and then first floor where everyone meets up in the kitchen. When entering the kitchen, you'll find the sink and counter to the left side, the oven, microwave and refrigerator to the right side and past them is the kitchen table. The last person to enter is June, who isn't looking forward when the door closes in on her. Instead of walking into the door, she actually walks through the door. June's clothes did not make it through the door and she fazed through them, her c-cup breasts jiggling in the wind with no garments covering them. "June are you alright?" You ask.

"How embarrassing." The door opens again and you see June walking back in. Actually you don't see her at all, she is invisible but she put her clothes back on, making it look like the clothes were possessed which since they are being worn by a ghost, they are. Attention is taken off of her though as you hear Spring ravaging the refrigerator. Her lower half sticking out from the opened door as she digs in for something to eat.

"Where's all of the food. I'm starving." The werewolf girl says as she checks every drawer, only finding vegetables, dairy products condiments, and an assortment of different beverages. She pulls her head out and starts sniffing the air, her wet dog nose wiggling with each inhale as she goes down on all fours and sniffs the ground. She walks towards you, sniffing up your pants then shirt, having no respect for personal space. She then passes by you and goes into the drawer behind you, finding a bag of jerky. info.description:
Marty McCallister and his fiance April have moved into a new house in Salem Oregon. Moving far away from their families to start a new life, the two finally get around to unloading all of their belongings in time for summer in their new, large home. While putting away somethings in the attic, April finds an old wooden musical box. What she didn't know is that the box is cursed and splits her into five separate versions of herself, each one representing a different personality. As if things couldn't get worst, the box also transforms them in very interesting ways. How will Marty handle not one but five girlfriends. Will this harem be a fantasy come true or a troubling nightmare? You'll have to read to find out.

Characters:
Marty McCallister (age 27) height 6'1, works as a business accountant, has spiky brown hair, brown eyes, a bit on the heavy side with broad shoulders and slightly tanned skin.
April Fitzgerald (age 23) height 5'7, elementary school teacher, long black hair, brown eyes, curvy waist, c-cup breasts. Usually the adventurous type, she likes to go hiking and is excited to try new things and explore Salem.

April's five different personalities;
The Gloomy Goth: This April represents the moody goth phase she went through in her teen years. Wearing black lipstick, mascara, and having her hair in braided pigtails which makes her look like Wednesday Addams.
The Brainy Nerd: April's intelligent side, this is the rational and observant part of your girlfriend. Seeming unfazed by most things, as she views worrying as just being wasted energy that can be best used to find a solution. She wears her glasses and has her hair in a bun.
The Cheerful Optimist: April's hyper and happy side, she is always in a good mood with a big smile. Representing April's time as a cheerleader, she is bursting with positive energy. She has her hair tied up in pigtails giving her a young and naive appearance.
The Shy Klutz: April's nurturing side, she is quite, hesitant, and maternal. Not wanting to be a bother and to make sure that everyone is safe, sadly she is not very coordinated. Keeps her hair down to give herself a natural look and to hide away her face when frightened.
The Angry Grump: April's aggressive side. She is dominant, take charge, confident, and makes up the back bone of your girlfriend. She is not always angry, just has a short temper. Hair tied back into a ponytail, so you know she mean business.

At the beginning of this story, it will be split up into different branches that focuses on a certain fetish. To add more varieties each girl would be affected differently. For example, if you want the girls to be turned into dog furries, then each one would be a different dog.

Rules:
1. Entries have to be at least 1500 letters long. This is to ensure that each chapter is guaranteed to have some quality.
2. Each chapter needs to have two or more choices unless it is the end.
3. Focus on the quality of your work please. All I ask is that you do the best you can, nothing more, nothing less.
4. Once a theme is chosen, please stick to that theme. Although you can add to it and have more than one theme.
5. If you want to add in a new fetish to theme the story around, you must describe how each personality is affected differently by it.
6. Other than that anything goes but most importantly is to have fun.

So I realized how confusing it is having five characters with the same name. For simplicity and to cut down on repetitive names, here below are the nicknames for the April doubles.

Goth April=Autumn
Happy April=Spring
